Issues.Title: Can't use calc() as arbitrary value
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** v3.3.3 **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** this [CDN](https://cdn.tailwindcss.com) **What browser are you using?** Opera **What operating system are you using?** Windows **Reproduction URL** https://play.tailwindcss.com/WSskKFuUi5 **Describe your issue** I wanted to use the sin() & cos() trigonometric functions and found out that the arbitrary calc() values don't work, or at least if you have some calculation inside of the calc(). Code i wanted to implement: `
`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Can't use calc() as arbitrary value" (#11861)

Issues.Title: Update eslint 8.45.0 ‚Üí 8.47.0 (minor)
Issues.Body:
Here is everything you need to know about this update. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ‚ú≥Ô∏è eslint-config-prettier (8.10.0 ‚Üí 9.0.0) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier) ¬∑ [Changelog](https://github.com/prettier/eslint-config-prettier/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md)
Release Notes

9.0.0 (from changelog)

  • Added: The CLI helper tool now works with eslint.config.js (flat config). Just like ESLint itself, the CLI tool automatically first tries eslint.config.js and then eslintrc, and you can force which one to use by setting the ESLINT_USE_FLAT_CONFIG environment variable. Note that the config of eslint-config-prettier has always been compatible with eslint.config.js (flat config) ‚Äì it was just the CLI tool that needed updating. On top of that, the docs have been updated to mention how to use both eslint.config.js (flat config) and eslintrc, and the tests now test both config systems.
  • Changed: unicode-bom is no longer turned off. Prettier preserves the BOM if you have one, and does not add one if missing. It was wrong of eslint-config-prettier to disable that rule. If you get ESLint errors after upgrading, either add "unicode-bom": "off" to your config to disable it again, or run ESLint with --fix to fix all files according to the rule (add or remove BOM). Thanks to Nicolas Stepien (@nstepien)!

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Commits

See the full diff on Github. The new version differs by 3 commits:

  • eslint-config-prettier v9.0.0
  • Do not disable unicode-bom (#250)
  • Flat config: CLI, tests, docs (#261)

Issues.Title: Erroneous lint warning applying scale-x and scale-y
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

tailwind v3.2.4
headless-ui 0.1.2

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

react-scripts 5.0.1

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

For example: v18.12.1

**What browser are you using?**

n/a (pre-compilation)

**What operating system are you using?**

MacOS

**Reproduction URL**

As this is a lint warning here is a screenshot instead of a URL
![Screen Shot 2023-08-17 at 11 57 16 AM](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/assets/94571813/68b11700-2af6-4556-b5b1-83510c38c476)

**Describe your issue**

This is just one of those annoying bugs that doesn't really affect anything after compilation.  But anyway... applying `scale-x-<num>` and `scale-y-<num>` results in a linting warning that I cannot seem to disappear with eslint-disable or ts-ignore. 

Actual warning: `'scale-x-[1.01]' applies the same CSS properties as 'scale-y-105'.(cssConflict)`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Erroneous lint warning applying scale-x and scale-y" (#11843)

Issues.Title: Enhancing Text Clarity: The Impact of the `font-smooth` Property in `preflight.css` üìù
Issues.Body:
Adding the `font-smooth` property in `preflight.css` helps render text with grayscale anti-aliasing instead of subpixel rendering. Switching from subpixel rendering to anti-aliasing for light text on dark backgrounds gives it a lighter appearance. This property has currently been added in Material-UI. For reference, you can check the following link: https://github.com/mui/material-ui/blob/ddf840bf3cc72ff863d91dabf65408fed3f5d046/packages/mui-material/src/CssBaseline/CssBaseline.js#L8.

I apologize if I've made any mistakes :(
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Enhancing Text Clarity: The Impact of the `font-smooth` Property in `preflight.css` üìù" (#11833)

Issues.Title: 'translate-x-[20%]' applies the same CSS properties as 'translate-y-[20%]'.(cssConflict)
Issues.Body:
### I want disable this warning ```css 'translate-x-[20%]' applies the same CSS properties as 'translate-y-[20%]'.(cssConflict) ```

### I have this code src/components/Switch.tsx ```tsx interface SwitchProps extends React.InputHTMLAttributes { isChecked: boolean onChange: () => void } export function Switch({ isChecked = false, onChange, ...props }: SwitchProps) { return ( ) } ``` error here - translate-x-[20%] translate-y-[20%]

### Reproduce example - [codesandbox](https://codesandbox.io/p/sandbox/dark-mode-w2s4gd?file=%2Fsrc%2FApp.tsx%3A28%2C50)

### I tried 1. Delete node_modules and package.json.lock and `yarn` 2. Put this setting in my settings.json (I use vscode) ```json "tailwindCSS.experimentalCSSValidation": false, ``` I got this error ``` Unknown Configuration Setting ``` **What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** ``` "dependencies": { "tailwind-merge": "^1.14.0", }, "devDependencies": { "autoprefixer": "^10.4.15", "tailwindcss": "^3.3.3", "postcss": "^8.4.28", ``` **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** React + Vite + TypeScript + tailwind + zustand
package.json ```json { "name": "codesandbox-dark-mode", "private": true, "version": "0.0.0", "type": "module", "scripts": { "dev": "vite --port 8000", "build": "tsc && vite build", "lint": "eslint src --ext ts,tsx --report-unused-disable-directives --max-warnings 0", "preview": "vite preview" }, "dependencies": { "@types/node": "^20.5.0", "class-variance-authority": "^0.7.0", "react": "^18.2.0", "react-dom": "^18.2.0", "react-icons": "^4.10.1", "react-router": "^6.12.1", "react-router-dom": "^6.12.1", "tailwind-merge": "^1.14.0", "zustand": "^4.4.1" }, "devDependencies": { "@types/react": "^18.2.7", "@types/react-dom": "^18.2.4", "@typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin": "^5.57.1", "@typescript-eslint/parser": "^5.57.1", "@vitejs/plugin-react-swc": "^3.0.0", "autoprefixer": "^10.4.15", "eslint": "^8.38.0", "eslint-plugin-react-hooks": "^4.6.0", "eslint-plugin-react-refresh": "^0.3.4", "postcss": "^8.4.28", "tailwindcss": "^3.3.3", "typescript": "^5.0.2", "vite": "^4.3.2" } } ```
**What version of Node.js are you using?** v16.17.0 **What browser are you using?** Chrome **What operating system are you using?** Kali linux (Is it take matter?)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "'translate-x-[20%]' applies the same CSS properties as 'translate-y-[20%]'.(cssConflict)" (#11839)

Issues.Title: Extend opacity scale to include all steps of 5
Issues.Body:
Originally the opacity scale just included the values `0`, `25`, `50`, `75`, and `100`. Then we added steps of 10 and we had this weird scale that was basically just steps of 10 but also had `25` and `75`. Then we found ourselves wanting a bit more fine-grained control at the extreme ends of the scale and added `5` and `95`, and at this point the scale just looked like a total garage sale. But because this was in the pre-JIT days, we lived with it to avoid the file size consequences of extending the scale with all of the 5 values.

The project I'm working on right now requires a `15%` value every 15 minutes and I'm sick of typing `[15%]` so here we are.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Extend opacity scale to include all steps of 5" (#11832)

Issues.Title: Gradients not working without @tailwind base;
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**
v3.3.3

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**
Sveltekit, vite

**What version of Node.js are you using?**
v20.5.1

**What browser are you using?**
Firefox 116.0

**What operating system are you using?**
For example: Pop_OS!

**Reproduction URL**
https://play.tailwindcss.com/fs55Iqxuae without base
https://play.tailwindcss.com/zbXudaH9dP with `@tailwind base;`

**Describe your issue**
I don't like to fight with the default stylings from `@tailwind base;` and i also like to keep my stylesheets as small as possible. gradient class names are available just from `@tailwind utilities`, so i don't see why can't they work without base. After some investigating i noticed that this is caused because some css variables missing like --tw-gradient-to-position etc... and writing them manually would be counter productive
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Gradients not working without @tailwind base;" (#11831)

Issues.Title: Obey EditorConfig
Issues.Body: Now all our bytes pass [`eclint`](https://github.com/szepeviktor/byte-level-care/blob/db9d972a6c789a190ed3faa0de701b1b494b0b23/.github/workflows/reusable-integrity.yml#L78-L83).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Obey EditorConfig" (#11808)

Issues.Title: Keep an eye on actions in CI workflows
Issues.Body:
GHA says

> The following actions uses node12 which is deprecated and will be forced to run on node16: actions-rs/toolchain@v1. For more info: https://github.blog/changelog/2023-06-13-github-actions-all-actions-will-run-on-node16-instead-of-node12-by-default/

Please consider enabling Dependabot for GitHub Actions. Once a week or once a month.
Here is the configuration.
https://github.com/szepeviktor/byte-level-care/blob/master/.github/dependabot.yml#L1-L10
Dependabot version updates can be enabled here.
https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/settings/security_analysis

From #11808
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Keep an eye on actions in CI workflows" (#11809)

Issues.Title: actions-rs is not supported
Issues.Body:
Let's remove `action-rs/*` actions!
https://github.com/actions-rs/toolchain/issues/216

Ubuntu images already contain up-to-date Rust tools.
https://github.com/actions/runner-images/blob/main/images/linux/Ubuntu2204-Readme.md#rust-tools
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "actions-rs is not supported" (#11811)

Issues.Title: Remove Rust installation from CI
Issues.Body:
Closes #11811

The latest version of Ubuntu includes Rust by default, so we don't need to use `actions-rs/toolchain` any longer. This PR removes that dependency and installation step from our various GitHub workflows.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Remove Rust installation from CI" (#11826)

Issues.Title: Integration tests report success ‚úîÔ∏è while failing
Issues.Body:
‚ö†Ô∏è Test could fail while being shiny green.
For example:
https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/actions/runs/5841674349/job/15842065117#step:11:142

The exit status does not change to non-zero.

https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/blob/f9d22f215814e25db64adf1d830d241e16929696/.github/workflows/integration-tests.yml#L94-L98

May be related: https://github.com/vercel/turbo/issues/5454

Discovered in #11808
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Integration tests report success ‚úîÔ∏è while failing" (#11810)

Issues.Title: Border Color not working when `focus:` in `darkMode: class`
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v3.3

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

play.tailwindcss.com

**What browser are you using?**

Firefox

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows

**Reproduction URL**

https://play.tailwindcss.com/sMKpyE0Ith

**Describe your issue**

So I want to see what my input would look like in dark mode so I enable the `darkMode` in configuration

```
module.exports = {
  darkMode: 'media',
  theme: {
    extend: {
      // ...
    },
  },
  plugins: [require('@tailwindcss/forms')],
}
```

Then in FireFox dev tools I click one with moon icon
![image](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/assets/131605935/07a197cc-5868-430e-a850-1892fd1eb7ca)
and it's working properly. It shows the border color when focused in dark mode.

But here's the problem, when I change the `darkMode` from `media` to `class` it's not changing the border color anymore.

Since I don't know how to add the `class="dark"` in html in the playground.  I change it directly in the dev tools.

![image](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/assets/131605935/fdf20055-2aa3-4d4c-974e-e5e99491bff0)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Border Color not working when `focus:` in `darkMode: class`" (#11800)

Issues.Body:
Here is everything you need to know about this update. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ‚ú≥Ô∏è vite (4.4.4 ‚Üí 4.4.9) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/vitejs/vite) ¬∑ [Changelog](https://github.com/vitejs/vite/blob/main/packages/vite/CHANGELOG.md)
Release Notes

4.4.9

Please refer to CHANGELOG.md for details.

4.4.8

Please refer to CHANGELOG.md for details.

4.4.7

Please refer to CHANGELOG.md for details.

4.4.6

Please refer to CHANGELOG.md for details.

4.4.5

Please refer to CHANGELOG.md for details.

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Commits

See the full diff on Github. The new version differs by 62 commits:

  • release: v4.4.9
  • chore: fix eslint warnings (#14031)
  • fix: dynamic import vars ignored warning (#14006)
  • chore(deps): update all non-major dependencies (#13938)
  • perf: improve build times and memory utilization (#14016)
  • perf: replace startsWith with === (#14005)
  • chore(deps-dev): bump json5 from 1.0.1 to 1.0.2 (#14002)
  • fix(build): silence warn dynamic import module when inlineDynamicImports true (#13970)
  • docs(wasm): add sections about Node.js and module access (#13978)
  • release: v4.4.8
  • fix: modulePreload false (#13973)
  • fix(esbuild): fix static properties transpile when useDefineForClassFields false (#13992)
  • fix(css): enhance error message for missing preprocessor dependency (#11485)
  • perf: replace startsWith with === (#13989)
  • fix(importAnalysis): strip url base before passing as safeModulePaths (#13712)
  • perf: single slash does not need to be replaced (#13980)
  • perf: use magic-string hires boundary for sourcemaps (#13971)
  • fix(optimizer): enable experimentalDecorators by default (#13981)
  • fix(importMetaGlob): avoid unnecessary hmr of negative glob (#13646)
  • chore(reporter): remove unnecessary map (#13972)
  • fix: multiple entries with shared css and no JS (#13962)
  • refactor: add new overload to the type of defineConfig (#13958)
  • fix(optimizer): avoid double-commit of optimized deps when discovery is disabled (#13865)
  • perf: use Intl.DateTimeFormatter instead of toLocaleTimeString (#13951)
  • fix(template): eliminate the error that occurs when enabling eslint-plugin-markdown (#13942)
  • fix: use file extensions on type imports so they work with `moduleResolution: 'node16'` (#13947)
  • perf: use Intl.NumberFormat instead of toLocaleString (#13949)
  • release: v4.4.7
  • fix: prepend `config.base` to vite/env path (#13941)
  • docs: remove note about firefox not supporting ESM imports in Web Workers (#13940)
  • fix: lightningcss fails with html-proxy (#13776)
  • fix(html): support `import.meta.env` define replacement without quotes (#13425)
  • fix(proxy): handle error when proxy itself errors (#13929)
  • docs(static-deploy): add deployment instructions for AWS Amplify Hosting (#13882)
  • test: restrict iife helpers injection (#13918)
  • docs(plugin-legacy): fix typo (#13936)
  • fix: `optimizeDeps.include` not working with paths inside packages (#13922)
  • chore(eslint): allow type annotations (#13920)
  • release: v4.4.6
  • fix: do not append `browserHash` on optimized deps during build (#13906)
  • fix: constrain inject helpers for iife (#13909)
  • feat(client): add guide to press Esc for closing the overlay (#13896)
  • fix: display manualChunks warning only when a function is not used (#13797) (#13798)
  • fix: use Bun's implementation of `ws` instead of the bundled one (#13901)
  • release: create-vite@4.4.1
  • release: plugin-legacy@4.1.1
  • release: v4.4.5
  • fix(build): remove warning about ineffective dynamic import from node_modules (#13884)
  • chore(deps): update dependency prettier to v3 (#13759)
  • fix: "EISDIR: illegal operation on a directory, realpath" error on RA‚Ä¶ (#13655)
  • fix: transform error message add file info (#13687)
  • fix(create-vite): fix eslint configuration for React templates (#13749)
  • fix: warn when publicDir and outDir are nested (#13742)
  • fix(types): narrow down the return type of `defineConfig` (#13792)
  • fix(deps): update all non-major dependencies (#13872)
  • docs: feedback about experimental features (#13846)
  • chore(deps): update tj-actions/changed-files action to v37 (#13873)
  • chore: replace `any` with `string` (#13850)
  • chore: fix typos (#13862)
  • chore(deps): update `@typescript-eslint/*` dependencies to v6.0.0 (#13817)
  • docs: fix build.cssMinify link (#13840)
  • fix(build): style insert order for UMD builds (fix #13668) (#13669)

Issues.Title: Update rollup 3.26.2 ‚Üí 3.28.0 (minor)
Issues.Body:
Here is everything you need to know about this update. Please take a good look at what changed and the test results before merging this pull request. ### What changed? #### ‚ú≥Ô∏è rollup (3.26.2 ‚Üí 3.28.0) ¬∑ [Repo](https://github.com/rollup/rollup) ¬∑ [Changelog](https://github.com/rollup/rollup/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md)
Release Notes

3.28.0

3.28.0

2023-08-09

Features

  • Add a new property preliminaryFileName to generated chunks containing the file name placeholder (#5086)
  • Improve performance of sourcemap generation by lazily decoding mappings (#5087)

Bug Fixes

  • Make the code property of rendered modules in the output readonly (#5091)

Pull Requests

  • #5086: feat: add preliminaryFileName to OutputChunk (@lsdsjy)
  • #5087: perf(sourcemaps): add back lazy sourcemap decode and handling nullish mappings (@thebanjomatic)
  • #5091: fix: the type of RenderedModule.code is readonly (@TrickyPi)

3.27.2

3.27.2

2023-08-04

Bug Fixes

  • Revert sourcemap performance improvement for now as it causes issues with Vite (#5075)

Pull Requests

  • #5075: Revert perf(sourcemap): lazy compute decoded mappings (@thebanjomatic)

3.27.1

3.27.1

2023-08-03

Bug Fixes

  • Improve performance when generating sourcemaps (#5075)

Pull Requests

  • #5075: perf(sourcemap): lazy compute decoded mappings (@thebanjomatic)

3.27.0

3.27.0

2023-07-28

Features

  • Mark Object.values and Object.entries as pure if their argument does not contain getters (#5072)

Pull Requests

  • #5070: chore(deps): lock file maintenance minor/patch updates (@renovate[bot])
  • #5071: docs(tutorial): change the .js extension to .mjs (@TrickyPi)
  • #5072: Add known globals (@sapphi-red)
  • #5078: chore(deps): update dependency @vue/eslint-config-prettier to v8 (@renovate[bot])
  • #5079: chore(deps): lock file maintenance minor/patch updates (@renovate[bot])

3.26.3

3.26.3

2023-07-17

Bug Fixes

  • Do not pass external modules to manualChunks to avoid breaking existing configs (#5068)

Pull Requests

  • #5056: chore(deps): lock file maintenance minor/patch updates (@renovate[bot])
  • #5059: chore(config): migrate renovate config (@renovate[bot])
  • #5064: chore(deps): update dependency prettier to v3 (@renovate[bot])
  • #5065: chore(deps): update typescript-eslint monorepo to v6 (major) (@renovate[bot])
  • #5068: fix: don't pass external modules to the manualChunks function (@TrickyPi)

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Commits

See the full diff on Github. The new version differs by 25 commits:

  • 3.28.0
  • feat: add `preliminaryFileName` to `OutputChunk` (#5086)
  • fix: the type of RenderedModule.code is readonly (#5091)
  • perf(sourcemaps): add back lazy sourcemap decode and handling nullish mappings (#5087)
  • 3.27.2
  • Revert perf(sourcemap): lazy compute decoded mappings (#5075)
  • 3.27.1
  • Update gitignore
  • perf(sourcemap): lazy compute decoded mappings (#5075)
  • Add codecov token
  • Exclude rollup-swc from REPL artefacts for now
  • Exclude rollup-swc from REPL artefacts for now
  • 3.27.0
  • chore(deps): lock file maintenance minor/patch updates (#5079)
  • Add known globals (#5072)
  • chore(deps): update dependency @vue/eslint-config-prettier to v8 (#5078)
  • chore(deps): lock file maintenance minor/patch updates (#5070)
  • docs(tutorial): change the .js extension to .mjs (#5071)
  • Fix issue number
  • 3.26.3
  • chore(deps): update typescript-eslint monorepo to v6 (major) (#5065)
  • chore(deps): update dependency prettier to v3 (#5064)
  • chore(config): migrate renovate config (#5059)
  • fix: don't pass external modules to the manualChunks function (#5068)
  • chore(deps): lock file maintenance minor/patch updates (#5056)

Issues.Title: VSCode extension doesn't work when the tailwind.config file is .ts instead of .js
Issues.Body:
**What version of VS Code are you using?**
Version: 1.81.0 (Universal)
Commit: 6445d93c81ebe42c4cbd7a60712e0b17d9463e97
Date: 2023-08-02T12:40:02.782Z
Electron: 22.3.18
ElectronBuildId: 22689846
Chromium: 108.0.5359.215
Node.js: 16.17.1
V8: 10.8.168.25-electron.0
OS: Darwin arm64 22.5.0

**What version of Tailwind CSS IntelliSense are you using?**
v0.9.11

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**
`"tailwindcss": "3.3.3"`

**What package manager are you using?**
npm

**What operating system are you using?**
macOS

**Tailwind config**
Unchanged from here: https://github.com/vercel/next.js/blob/canary/packages/create-next-app/templates/default-tw/ts/tailwind.config.ts

**VS Code settings**
unchanged default settings

**Reproduction URL**
https://github.com/vercel/next.js/blob/canary/packages/create-next-app/templates/default-tw/ts/tailwind.config.ts

**Describe your issue**
When creating a new NextJS project with the CLI wizard and then choosing TypeScript and TailwindCSS in the process, the created tailwind.config file as a .ts extension instead of a .js extension. Therefore the VSCode extension doesn't work
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "VSCode extension doesn't work when the tailwind.config file is .ts instead of .js" (#11788)

Issues.Title: feat: Compatible with applet rpx
Issues.Body:
<!--

üëã Hey, thanks for your interest in contributing to Tailwind!

**Please ask first before starting work on any significant new features.**

It's never a fun experience to have your pull request declined after investing a lot of time and effort into a new feature. To avoid this from happening, we request that contributors create an issue to first discuss any significant new features. This includes things like adding new utilities, creating new at-rules, or adding new component examples to the documentation.

https://github.com/tailwindcss/tailwindcss/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md

-->

#11090
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "feat: Compatible with applet rpx" (#11787)

Issues.Title: Excess generation of pseudo classes for the `label` html tag
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**: v3.3.3
**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**: cargo-leptos 0.1.11; leptos 0.4 
**What version of Node.js are you using?**: v18.17.0
**What browser are you using?**: Chrome
**What operating system are you using?**: Windows

**Reproduction URL**: https://play.tailwindcss.com/Y5XTAWlETw?file=css

**Describe your issue**:
Tailwind adds the excess pseudo class "checked":
![image](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/assets/18236144/52adb629-3453-4e22-9c5f-792845c50519)

I expected this:  `#menu-button:checked ~ .menu-button-label`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Excess generation of pseudo classes for the `label` html tag" (#11767)

**tailwind css verion?** "tailwindcss": "^3.3.3", **node verion?** v16.16.0 **the browser that i am useing is brave. its version is ** [Version 1.56.20 Chromium: 115.0.5790.171 (Official Build) (arm64)](https://brave.com/latest/) I am using react and webpack as a build tool the operating system is mac m1 https://github.com/tarik350/text-analyzer.git : you can get the whole code in this repository ```javascript import React from "react"; const Footer = () => { return (

built by Tarik Teshome

About
contact me
); }; export default Footer; ``` ```javascript
``` as you can see on this specific line i have applied a shodow-md. but it turns out that it won't apply.although it works when i remove absolute and bottom-0 properties.
